Class BitsStorage

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.gliblybits.bitsengine.core.BitsStorage

  • public class BitsStorage
extends java.lang.Object

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static java.lang.String EXTERNAL_STORAGE_STATE_MOUNTED 
      static java.lang.String EXTERNAL_STORAGE_STATE_MOUNTED_RO 
      static java.lang.String EXTERNAL_STORAGE_STATE_NOT_READY 
      static int MODE_APPEND
      If the file already exists then write data to the end of the existing file instead of erasing it.
      static int MODE_PRIVATE
      The created file can only be accessed by the calling application (or all applications sharing the same user ID).
      static int MODE_WORLD_READABLE
      Allow all other applications to have read access to the created file.
      static int MODE_WORLD_WRITABLE
      Allow all other applications to have write access to the created file.

    • Field Detail

      • MODE_PRIVATE

        public static final int MODE_PRIVATE
        The created file can only be accessed by the calling application (or all applications sharing the same user ID).

      • MODE_APPEND

        public static final int MODE_APPEND
        If the file already exists then write data to the end of the existing file instead of erasing it.

      • MODE_WORLD_READABLE

        public static final int MODE_WORLD_READABLE
        Allow all other applications to have read access to the created file.

      • MODE_WORLD_WRITABLE

        public static final int MODE_WORLD_WRITABLE
        Allow all other applications to have write access to the created file.

      • getExternalStorageState

        public final java.lang.String getExternalStorageState()
        Gets the current state of the primary "external" storage device.
        Returns:
        State of the external storage

      • getExternalPublicFilesDir

        public final java.io.File getExternalPublicFilesDir(java.lang.String name,
                                     boolean visibleToMediaScanner)
        This method returns a path to a directory on the external storage device.
        Parameters:
        name - Name of the directory on the external storage device. It will be created, if the directory doesn't exist. If this is null, the method will return the root directory of the external storage device.
        visibleToMediaScanner - If the given path doesn't exist and this is set to false, this method will create a file named ".nomedia" in the new directory.
        Returns:
        File reference to the given path.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • getExternalPrivateFilesDir

        public final java.io.File getExternalPrivateFilesDir()
        Returns the absolute path to the directory on the external filesystem where the application
        can place persistent files it owns. These files are private to the applications, and not typically
        visible to the user as media.
        The path will be created if it doesn't exist.
        Returns the path of the directory holding application files on external storage.
        Returns null if external storage is not currently mounted so it could not ensure the path exists;
        you will need to call this method again when it is available.
        Returns:

      • writeExternalPrivateFile

        public final void writeExternalPrivateFile(java.lang.String fileName,
                            byte[] buffer)

        public final void readExternalPrivateFile(java.lang.String fileName,

      • getInternalPrivateFilesDir

        public final java.io.File getInternalPrivateFilesDir()
        Returns the absolute path to the directory on the filesystem where files created with writePrivateFile are stored.
        Returns:
        Returns the absolute path of the directory holding application files or null if the AppContext is null.

      • writeInternalPrivateFile

        public final void writeInternalPrivateFile(java.lang.String fileName,
                            int mode,
                            java.lang.String buffer)
        Writes a given String to a private file. Path separators in the file name will be ignored!

        The mode value defines the kind of file handling.
        You can combine multiple modes like this: MODE_PRIVATE | MODE_APPEND
        See: MODE_PRIVATE, MODE_APPEND, MODE_WORLD_READABLE, WORLD_WRITABLE
        Parameters:
        fileName - - name of the file; can not contain path separators.
        mode - - MODE_PRIVATE, MODE_APPEND, MODE_WORLD_READABLE, WORLD_WRITABLE
        buffer - - String to write to file
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • writeInternalPrivateFile

        public final void writeInternalPrivateFile(java.lang.String fileName,
                            int mode,
                            byte[] buffer)
        Writes a given String to a private file. Path separators in the file name will be ignored!

        The mode value defines the kind of file handling.
        You can combine multiple modes like this: MODE_PRIVATE | MODE_APPEND
        See: MODE_PRIVATE, MODE_APPEND, MODE_WORLD_READABLE, WORLD_WRITABLE
        Parameters:
        fileName - - name of the file; can not contain path separators.
        mode - - MODE_PRIVATE, MODE_APPEND, MODE_WORLD_READABLE, WORLD_WRITABLE
        buffer - - buffer to write to file
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • readInternalPrivateFile

        public final void readInternalPrivateFile(java.lang.String fileName,
                           byte[] buffer)

      • deleteInternalPrivateFile

        public final boolean deleteInternalPrivateFile(java.lang.String fileName)
        Deletes a private file.
        Parameters:
        fileName - - the file to delete; can not contain path separators.
        Returns:
        True if the file was successfully deleted; else false

      • getInternalPrivateFiles

        public final java.lang.String[] getInternalPrivateFiles()
        Returns an array of strings naming the private files associated with this application package.
        Returns:
        Array of strings naming the private files or null if the AppContext is null.

      • storeInt

        public final boolean storeInt(java.lang.String key,
               int value)
        Stores an Integer value directly under the given key. This data is private!
        Parameters:
        key - - the key or id to retrieve the stored data later
        value - - the value to store
        Returns:
        - true if the data has been stored successfully, else otherwise

        Parameters:
        key - - the key or id the data has been stored
        Returns:
        the value to the given key or -1 if no value exists for the given key
